category: Articles of Incorporation/Article 13 (Demotion and expulsion of member organizations)
contents: Article 13 (Demotion or expulsion of member organizations) ① When a regular member organization is deemed unsuitable as a member of the Sports Association by violating the obligations of Article 10, Paragraph 2, the Sports Association may demote or expel it by a vote of more than two-thirds of the registered delegates at the general meeting. You can. If the regular member organization in question is a member sports organization, the sports association must inform and consult with the international sports federation to which the organization belongs in advance. If it is a member city/provincial sports association, it must notify the head of the local government that approved the establishment of the organization in advance. There must be consultation. Revised 2020. 10. 13., 2021. 7. 5., ② When an associate member organization is deemed unsuitable as a member of the Sports Association by violating the obligations of Article 10, Paragraph 4, the Sports Association shall approve the decision by the Board of Directors with a vote of more than two-thirds of the registered directors. May be demoted or expelled. Revised July 5, 2021, ③ In cases where a member organization is to be demoted or expelled pursuant to paragraphs 1 and 2, the relevant organization shall be given an opportunity to explain itself prior to the resolution. ④ In addition to what is stipulated in these Articles of Incorporation, the demotion or expulsion of member organizations shall be determined separately.
